raw_salmon.notes: Avoid raw salmon due to listeria risk

raw_tuna.notes: High mercury content and listeria risk

raw_fish.notes: Risk of foodborne illness from raw fish

sushi.notes: Contains raw fish with listeria and mercury risks

raw_oysters.notes: Risk of vibrio and other bacterial infections

unpasteurized_cheese.notes: Risk of listeria from soft unpasteurized cheeses

brie.notes: Soft cheese with potential listeria contamination

undercooked_eggs.notes: Ensure eggs are fully cooked to prevent salmonella

raw_meat.notes: Risk of toxoplasmosis and bacterial infection

undercooked_meat.notes: Ensure meat is fully cooked to safe temperatures

deli_meat.notes: Heat to steaming before eating to prevent listeria

liver.notes: High vitamin A content, limit consumption

caffeine.notes: Limit to <200mg per day during pregnancy

coffee.notes: Limit to 1-2 cups per day (under 200mg caffeine)

green_tea.notes: Contains caffeine, limit to 1-2 cups daily

alcohol.notes: No safe level of alcohol during pregnancy

wine.notes: Alcohol can cause fetal alcohol syndrome

beer.notes: Contains alcohol which is harmful during pregnancy

unpasteurized_milk.notes: Risk of listeria and other bacterial infections

herbal_tea.notes: Some herbs may be unsafe, consult healthcare provider

ginger.notes: Generally safe and may help with nausea

turmeric.notes: Safe in food amounts, avoid supplements

spinach.notes: Rich in folate, generally safe and beneficial

kale.notes: Excellent source of folate and iron

broccoli.notes: High in folate, vitamin C, and fiber

carrots.notes: Good source of beta-carotene and fiber

sweet_potato.notes: Rich in vitamin A and fiber

banana.notes: Good source of potassium and vitamin B6

apple.notes: High in fiber and vitamin C

orange.notes: Excellent source of vitamin C and folate

berries.notes: Rich in antioxidants and vitamin C

strawberries.notes: High in vitamin C and folate

salmon.notes: Low mercury fish, good source of omega-3s when cooked

sardines.notes: Low mercury, high in omega-3 fatty acids

anchovies.notes: Low mercury fish, safe when cooked

shrimp.notes: Low mercury shellfish when fully cooked

crab.notes: Low mercury shellfish when fully cooked

tuna.notes: Limit to 6oz per week due to mercury content

albacore_tuna.notes: Higher mercury than light tuna, limit consumption

turkey.notes: Good protein source when fully cooked

beef.notes: Good iron source when fully cooked

pork.notes: Safe when cooked to proper temperature

cheddar.notes: Hard cheese, generally pasteurized and safe

yogurt.notes: Good source of calcium and probiotics

milk.notes: Pasteurized milk is safe and nutritious

beans.notes: Excellent source of protein and folate

lentils.notes: High in protein, iron, and folate

chickpeas.notes: Good source of protein and fiber

quinoa.notes: Complete protein and good source of folate

whole_wheat.notes: Good source of B vitamins and fiber

nuts.notes: Healthy fats and protein, unless allergic

almonds.notes: Good source of vitamin E and healthy fats

peanuts.notes: Safe unless allergic, good protein source

flax_seeds.notes: Good source of omega-3 fatty acids

honey.notes: Safe for pregnant women (botulism risk only for infants)

garlic.notes: Safe and may have health benefits

tomato.notes: Rich in lycopene and vitamin C

cauliflower.notes: Rich in folate and vitamin C

zucchini.notes: Low calorie, good source of vitamins

mushrooms.notes: Safe when cooked, avoid wild varieties

beets.notes: Good source of folate and fiber

potato.notes: Good source of potassium when cooked

squash.notes: Good source of vitamins A and C

cantaloupe.notes: High in vitamin A and C

pineapple.notes: Rich in vitamin C, safe in normal amounts

mango.notes: High in vitamin A and C

papaya.notes: Ripe papaya is safe, avoid unripe papaya

figs.notes: Good source of calcium and fiber

prunes.notes: High in fiber, may help with constipation

parsley.notes: Rich in folate and vitamin C

mint.notes: Safe and may help with nausea

sage.notes: Safe in small culinary amounts, avoid large quantities

salt.notes: Use in moderation, watch sodium intake

lemon.notes: High in vitamin C, may help with nausea

flour.notes: Safe when used in cooked products

molasses.notes: Good source of iron when used sparingly

milk_chocolate.notes: Contains caffeine and sugar, consume moderately
